desc: mViewer generates a JPEG image file with overlays from a FITS file (or a set of three FITS files in color).

arguments.name: mode
arguments.desc: Type of the command string: Type of the command string: 0 for JSON file, 1 for JSON, 2 for 'command' string.

return.name: status
return.desc: Return status (0: OK, 1:ERROR).

return.name: msg
return.desc: Return message (for errors).

return.name: type
return.desc: 'grayscale' or 'color'.

return.name: nx
return.desc: Output image width.

return.name: ny
return.desc: Output image height.

return.name: grayminval
return.desc: Gray file: Minimum stretch data value.

return.name: grayminpercent
return.desc: Gray file: Histogram percentile level for min stretch value.

return.name: grayminsigma
return.desc: Gray file: 'Sigma' level for min stretch value.

return.name: graymaxval
return.desc: Gray file: Maximum stretch data value.

return.name: graymaxpercent
return.desc: Gray file: Histogram percentile level for max stretch value.

return.name: graymaxsigma
return.desc: Gray file: 'Sigma' level for max stretch value.

return.name: blueminval
return.desc: Blue file: Minimum stretch data value.

return.name: blueminpercent
return.desc: Blue file: Histogram percentile level for min stretch value.

return.name: blueminsigma
return.desc: Blue file: 'Sigma' level for min stretch value.

return.name: bluemaxval
return.desc: Blue file: Maximum stretch data value.

return.name: bluemaxpercent
return.desc: Blue file: Histogram percentile level for max stretch value.

return.name: bluemaxsigma
return.desc: Blue file: 'Sigma' level for max stretch value.

return.name: greenminval
return.desc: Green file: Minimum stretch data value.

return.name: greenminpercent
return.desc: Green file: Histogram percentile level for min stretch value.

return.name: greenminsigma
return.desc: Green file: 'Sigma' level for min stretch value.

return.name: greenmaxval
return.desc: Green file: Maximum stretch data value.

return.name: greenmaxpercent
return.desc: Green file: Histogram percentile level for max stretch value.

return.name: greenmaxsigma
return.desc: Green file: 'Sigma' level for max stretch value.

return.name: redminval
return.desc: Red file: Minimum stretch data value.

return.name: redminpercent
return.desc: Red file: Histogram percentile level for min stretch value.

return.name: redminsigma
return.desc: Red file: 'Sigma' level for min stretch value.

return.name: redmaxval
return.desc: Red file: Maximum stretch data value.

return.name: redmaxpercent
return.desc: Red file: Histogram percentile level for max stretch value.

return.name: redmaxsigma
return.desc: Red file: 'Sigma' level for max stretch value.

return.name: graydatamin
return.desc: Gray file: Minimum data value in file.

return.name: graydatamax
return.desc: Gray file: Maximum data value in file.

return.name: bdatamin
return.desc: Blue file: Minimum data value in file.

return.name: bdatamax
return.desc: Blue file: Maximum data value in file.

return.name: gdatamin
return.desc: Green file: Minimum data value in file.

return.name: gdatamax
return.desc: Green file: Maximum data value in file.

return.name: rdatamin
return.desc: Red file: Minimum data value in file.

return.name: rdatamax
return.desc: Red file: Maximum data value in file.

return.name: flipX
return.desc: 1 if X axis was flipped (to better represent the sky).

return.name: flipY
return.desc: 1 if Y axis was flipped.

return.name: colortable
return.desc: Grayscale color table used.

return.name: bunit
return.desc: Data units from FITS header (assumed the same for color images).
